name: AWS EBS volumes are not encrypted
description: This policy identifies the EBS volumes which are not encrypted. The snapshots that you take of an encrypted EBS volume are also encrypted and can be moved between AWS Regions as needed. You cannot share encrypted snapshots with other AWS accounts and you cannot make them  It is recommended that EBS volume should be encrypted.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name = 'aws-ec2-describe-volumes' AND json.rule = 'encrypted is false'
recommendation:
1. Login to the AWS Console and goto the EC2 service.
2. Click on the 'Volumes' under the 'Elastic Block Store' in left hand menu.
3. Click on the EBS volume and verify the property 'Encrypted' under 'Description' tab. It will be 'Not Encrypted'.
4. Migrate the data from this EBS volume to a new EBS volume (whose encryption is turned on) and make the corresponding changes to instances which used the unencrypted EBS volume.
